articles.title: Truth about Shelling Fabricated by S. Korean Military Warmongers Exposed
articles.content:
Truth about Shelling Fabricated by S. Korean Military Warmongers Exposed
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- The south Korean military warmongers are faking up again the burlesque that the army of the DPRK committed shelling "provocation" in the waters around Yonphyong Island and kicking up an anti-DPRK racket by mobilizing major media including KBS, MBC and Yonhap TV.
					
					The head of the north side to the north-south military working-level talks gave the following answer to a question put by KCNA today in this connection:
					
					At a time when a dynamic drive is making successful progress to build a thriving nation in all parts of the DPRK, there was normal blasting in the area of South Hwanghae Province close to the five islands in the West Sea of Korea on August 10 as part of the brisk construction of a gigantic object aimed at improving the standard of people's living,
					
					Frightened by this, the south Korean military warmongers spread misinformation that the army of the DPRK perpetrated a shelling "provocation." They went the lengths of militarily reacting to this under that pretext. 
					
					It was preposterous in the age of science when latest detecting and intelligence means are available that they mistook the blasting for shelling and they proved shells fell in the waters around the "northern limit line" though no shells were fired. It was a tragicomedy that they indiscriminately reacted to what happened with counter-shelling even without confirming the truth about the case in the sensitive waters of the West Sea of Korea.
					
					In order to paint the case as a "provocation" of the army of the DPRK, the south Korean military is making much fuss that its forces made a prompt "retaliatory action" as the firing of three shells was heard from near Yonphyong Island in the West Sea and one shell might have flown across the "northern limit line, " a sheer fiction.
					
					In order to make their farce sound plausible, the south Korean belligerent elements made much fuss. They urgently increased the number of combat warships and flew fighters in the air near the five islands in the West Sea and alerted the frontline units. They, at the same time, ordered all the fishing boats of the south side to stop their operations and sail back to their ports and evacuated inhabitants.
					
					The army of the DPRK cannot overlook the actions taken by the south Korean military to orchestrate another poor anti-DPRK charade in broad daylight on the basis of their misjudgment of the normal blasting made in the course of peaceable construction as shelling provocation.
					
					The recent military racket was an extension of the inveterate bad habit of the tricksters. They fabricated the "Cheonan" warship sinking case, the hideous conspiratorial farce unprecedented in the history of the nation, launching an all-out confrontation with fellow countrymen.  Not content with this, they committed the Yonphyong Island shelling, driving the situation on the Korean Peninsula to the worst war phase of exchange of fire. 
					
					Such burlesque is a product of the deliberate moves of the belligerent forces of the south Korean military to vitiate the atmosphere of dialogue in the Korean Peninsula and its vicinity and push the inter-Korean relations to the worst phase of confrontation and clash.
					
					The DPRK side sent an open letter to the U.S. and the south Korean authorities in the name of the Panmunjom mission of the Korean People's Army, urging them to cancel their projected Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises this year. What merits a serious attention is that they faked up the above-said case to achieve their sinister aim to stage this saber-rattling as planned at any cost, defying the warning, in a bid to strain the situation on the Korean Peninsula again. 
					
					Lurking behind the recent racket is an ulterior aim: To secure a pretext for staging the above-said saber-rattling through the shelling case in a bid to have justification to launch an actual war of aggression against the north any time, while inciting atmosphere of confrontation with the DPRK through the fabrication of all kinds of "spy ring cases", "cases of the violation of the National Security Law" and "attempted assassinations". 
					
					Plots and fabrications are trite methods employed by those in a crisis.
					
					What has become clear once again through the recent case is that the south Korean authorities, belligerent forces of the military, in particular, are the master hands at plots and fabrications who stoop to any infamy to escalate the confrontation with fellow countrymen.
					
					The criminals can never escape a stern judgment by all the fellow countrymen.
					
					The army and people of the DPRK will resolutely shatter all the plots and fabrications of those confrontation-minded elements against the DPRK and keep advancing to improve the inter-Korean relations and achieve the peace and reunification of the nation.

articles.title: Congratulatory Message to President-elect of Sao Tome and Principe
articles.content:
Congratulatory Message to President-elect of Sao Tome and Principe
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent  a congratulatory message to Manuel Pinto Da Costa, president-elect of the  Democratic Republic of Sao Tome and Principe.
					
					Kim in the message wished Manuel Pinto Da Costa great success in his responsible work for the stability and prosperity of the country, expressing the belief that the bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation would grow stronger in the future.

articles.title: Congratulations to Macedonian PM
articles.content:
Congratulations to Macedonian PM
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim Wednesday sent a congratulatory message to Nikola Gruevski upon his reappointment as prime minister of the Republic of Macedonia.
					
					Choe wished Nikola success in his work for the development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Congratulations to Thai PM
articles.content:
Congratulations to Thai PM
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim on August 9 sent a congratulatory message to Yingluck Shinawatra upon her appointment as Prime Minister of the Kingdom of Thailand. 
					
					Choe in the message wished Yingluck Shinawatra success in her work for the stability and prosperity of the country, expressing belief that the long-standing friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would steadily grow stronger as desired by the peoples of the two countries.

articles.title: Greetings to Chadian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Chadian President
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) - Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Tuesday sent a massage of greetings to Idriss Deby Itno, president of the Republic of Chad, on the 51st anniversary of its independence.
					
					Kim in his message wished the Chadian president great success in his work to achieve national reconciliation and economic development, expressing expectation that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop.

articles.title: Pyongyang Sinmun Delegation Departs for China
articles.content:
Pyongyang Sinmun Delegation Departs for China
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Sinmun delegation headed by its Deputy Editor-in-Chief Kim Sang Ryong left here Wednesday to visit China.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Gets Familiar with Work in Different Domains of National Economy
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Gets Familiar with Work in Different Domains of National Economy
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Choe Yong Rim got familiar with the work in different domains of the national economy from August 6 to 10.
					
					He went round the national exhibition of August 3 consumer goods, the Anju Insulating Material Factory, the Rakrang District Fuel Station, the Pyongyang 326 Electric Wire Factory and the East Pyongyang Thermal Power Plant and held consultative meetings with officials concerned.
					
					The meetings discussed measures to boost the production of quality consumer goods, put the production of insulating materials on a Juche basis, supply sufficient quantities of fuel for the people's living, increase the production of electric wire urgently required by different domains of the national economy and satisfactorily ensure coal for power production, true to the high intention of leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: DPRK to Take Part in Asian Regional Preliminaries for World Cup
articles.content:
DPRK to Take Part in Asian Regional Preliminaries for World Cup
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- The DPRK will compete in the third-stage Asian regional preliminaries for the 2014 World Cup.
					
					The DPRK belongs to Group C in the preliminaries, which will take place from September to February next year. It will meet with Japan on September 2 and November 15, Syria on September 6 and February 29 next year and Uzbekistan on October 11 and November 11. 
					
					The DPRK will also participate in the preliminaries for the 2012 Asian U-16 Football Championship. 
					
					The preliminaries will be held on a round-robin basis, divided into seven groups involving scores of countries and regions.  
					
					The league matches of Group E, including the DPRK, will take place in Pyongyang in September. The DPRK will have matches with East Timor on the 8th, Malaysia on the 10th, Singapore on the 13th, Macao, China, on the 15th and China on the 18th.

articles.title: Friendly Meeting with Staff Members of Malaysian Embassy Held
articles.content:
Friendly Meeting with Staff Members of Malaysian Embassy Held
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- A friendly meeting with staff members of the Malaysian embassy was held at the DPRK-Malaysia Friendship Pyongyang Ryusong Secondary School on Wednesday on the occasion of the national day of Malaysia.
					
					Present there on invitation were Charge d'Affaires ad Interim Mohamad Hasril Abdul Hamid and staff members of the Malaysian embassy here.
					
					Vice-Chairman Pak Kyong Il and other members of the DPRK-Malaysia Friendship Association, teachers and students of the school were present.
					
					After being briefed on the history of the school, the participants looked round its educational facilities.
					
					They talked to one another about the need to boost the relations between the DPRK and Malaysia and enjoyed an art performance given by its students.

articles.title: Construction Engineering and Standards Institute
articles.content:
Construction Engineering and Standards Institute
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- The Construction Engineering and Standards Institute, founded on August 7, Juche 50 (1961), specializes in studying and formulating construction-related regulations and standards.
					
					The well-equipped institute also provides technological information service to the construction sector.
					
					It, with many people honored with the title of Merited Scientist and academic degrees and titles, has applied several hundred pieces of regulations and standards to major construction projects, rendering scientific and technological assistance to them and giving much profit to the country.
					
					Some of its inventions won prizes at the May 21 Architectural Festival, an annual event.

articles.title: Historic Meeting Significant in Anti-Japanese Struggle
articles.content:
Historic Meeting Significant in Anti-Japanese Struggle
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung convened a historic meeting of military and political cadres of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army (KPRA) in Xiaohaerbaling on August 10, Juche 29 (1940).
					
					The meeting was of weighty significance in the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle.
					
					Song Tong Won, director of the Institute of Kim Il Sung's Revolutionary Activities of the Academy of Social Sciences, told KCNA a policy of switching large-unit activities to small-unit activities was adopted at the meeting.
					
					The policy made it possible to weaken the Japanese imperialists' aggression forces, put them in the passive and ensure the revolutionary forces' decisive and positive activities with intensive small-unit activities, he said.
					
					Jong Chi Gon, a teacher of the History Faculty of Kim Il Sung University, said the President, with a scientific insight into the rapidly changing situation and the requirement of the developing revolution, set forth a new goal and tactics to provide favorable conditions for the country's liberation.
					
					At the meeting the President called for preserving the KPRA and training its members as able political and military cadres necessary to achieve the liberation of the country, he added.
					
					Nam Kyong Chon, deputy curator of the Korean Revolution Museum, said that the meeting was a landmark event that encouraged people of all social strata to turn out in making preparations for an all-people resistance.

articles.title: DPRK Scientists' Success in Research into Amino Acid-Microelement Fertilizer
articles.content:
DPRK Scientists' Success in Research into Amino Acid-Microelement Fertilizer
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- Scientists of the Central Laboratory of State Academy of Sciences in the DPRK succeeded in researching into amino acid-microelement fertilizer in an indigenous manner. It is now in wide use. 
					
					This is a chemical combination of composite amino acid extracted from feathers of poultry such as hen and duck and dozens of microelements extracted from Kumgang medical stone and rare-earth elements. 
					
					It is easy to apply the fertilizer everywhere as its production process is simple and its production cost is low. 
					
					The scientists conducted researches and established rational methods of production and use and proved its economic efficiency on several farms of the country. 
					
					It has been applied to farming at more than 80 units. 
					
					As a result, they boosted the yield of rice, maize and vegetables, while cutting down the amount of chemical fertilizer 30-50 percent.
					
					They, at the same time, applied it to seed processing, increasing the rate of germinating 7-10 percent while cutting down its time.

articles.title: New Departments Open in Medical Centers
articles.content:
New Departments Open in Medical Centers
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- More than 20 new departments have opened in central-level hospitals in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					
					A functional recovery centre has started its medical service in Kim Man Yu Hospital.
					
					The 10-room centre works on stroke, trauma, bradyacusia and aphasia.
					
					The Pyongyang Maternity Hospital has been newly furnished with an angiography department and an obstetrical anesthesia research center.  
					
					The department treats women with myoma by cutting off tumor-nourishing blood vessels, not in a surgical way.
					
					The General Dental Hospital has seven new departments, including dental prosthesis shop, tumor surgical department and dental hygiene department.
					
					A vitreous-retina department has come into being at the Pyongyang Ophthalmology Hospital.

articles.title: Fries Put into Large Artificial Lakes in Huichon Area
articles.content:
Fries Released into Large Man-made Lakes in Huichon Area
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- Over 105 000 fries were released into large man-made lakes that appeared in the upper reaches of the Rivers Jangja and Chongchon as a result of the construction of huge dams in Huichon area of the DPRK.
					
					Water at the Huichon dam reached 90 percent of its storage capacity. The level of water has reached more than 45 meters at the Ryongrim dam since it began storing water in July. 
					
					Many shrubs were inundated and planktons rapidly increased in vast areas, creating environment favorable for fish inhabitation.

articles.title: Sea Bass Dishes Good for Health in Summer
articles.content:
Sea Bass Dishes Good for Health in Summer
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- In Korea there is a saying, "Only seeing sea bass in July is enough for good health".
					
					The saying means sea bass has a good effect on health in summer.
					
					Sea bass comes up to river mouth to find something to eat from June to August.
					
					The fish contains protein, oil, mineral matters, calcium, vitamin A and fatty acid.
					
					Sea bass dishes are soft, digestive and sweet-flavored, giving no smell of raw fish. They are efficacious for ageing and anemia.
					
					According to old records, the fish helps pregnant women feel comfortable and refreshed. Sea bass soup is good for women in childbed in arresting bleeding and resting themselves.
					
					In the hottest period of summer, public catering establishments draw many people for health food, including sea bass dishes.
					
					Sea bass is usually taken in the way of steamed dish, soup and sliced raw fish. It is also diverse in processing method.

articles.title: Plenary Meeting of Union of Agricultural Workers Held
articles.content:
Plenary Meeting of UAWK Held
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- The 63rd plenary meeting of the Central Committee of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea took place in Pyongyang on Wednesday.
					
					Present at the meeting were members and alternate members of the C.C., the UAWK and officials of the union's organizations in Pyongyang and local areas.
					
					The meeting discussed the tasks for the union organizations to conduct a socialist emulation and mass movement which greatly help bringing about signal innovations in agricultural production in the run-up to the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					Ri Myong Gil, chairman of the C.C., the UAWK, made a report which was followed by speeches.

articles.title: Up-and-coming Woman Marathoner
articles.content:
Up-and-coming Woman Marathoner
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Kum Ok, a 23-year-old Korean girl,  won the women's marathon race of the 5th Military World Games held in Brazil in July.
					
					Her record was two hours, 35 minutes and 28 seconds.
					
					Back home, she told KCNA that she ran with courage and self-confidence with which leader Kim Jong Il inspired Korean athletes.
					
					After graduating from Mangyongdae District Juvenile Sports School, she has distinguished herself in international field and track tournaments.
					
					She won the 10th and 11th Asian Marathon Championships and the women's half marathon race of the 24th Universiad.

articles.title: Typhoon-9 Brings Strong Wind, Heavy Rain to DPRK
articles.content:
Typhoon-9 Brings Strong Wind, Heavy Rain to DPRK
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- Strong wind and heavy rain, triggered by typhoon-9, swept some areas of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					
					10 to 15 m/s wind was observed in South Phyongan, South and North Hwanghae and Kangwon provinces between Sunday night and Monday.
					
					In particular, the wind blew 20 m/s in Onchon County of Nampho City, 19 m/s in Samsok District of Pyongyang and Jangphung County of Kaesong City, 18 m/s in Sariwon City and Sohung County of North Hwanghae Province, Ongjin, Yonan, Kangryong, Samchon and Pongchon counties of South Hwanghae Province and 17 m/s in Haeju City, Paechon, Ryongyon and Chongdan counties of South Hwanghae Province.
					
					From 21:00 Sunday to 12:00 Tuesday, above 100 mm rainfalls hit nearly 20 areas of the country. It rained 170 mm, 132 mm and 128 mm respectively in Sinchon, Pyoksong and Sinwon counties, South Hwanghae Province, 126 mm in Rinsan County, North Hwanghae Province, 156 mm, 119 mm and 117 mm respectively in Kusong City, Chonma and Tongchang counties, North Phyongan Province, 125 mm in Songwon County, Jagang Province, 115 mm and 114 mm respectively in Sudong District and Pujon County, South Hamgyong Province.
					
					Relief activities are now under way in the afflicted areas.

articles.title: Typhoon Inflicts Damage on DPRK
articles.content:
Typhoon Inflicts Damage on DPRK
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- Typhoon-9 left more than ten people dead or wounded and over 240 dwelling houses destroyed throughout the DPRK from Sunday evening to Tuesday, according to results of a survey.
					
					Strong winds and heavy rainfalls seriously damaged some 25 800 hectares of standing crop in South and North Hwanghae provinces, major grain producers of the country, South Hamgyong Province and other areas and destroyed scores of public buildings.
					
					Over ten bridges were broken and some 4 000 roadside trees fell down, making it difficult to transport relief goods and materials to the afflicted areas.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Fresh Turn in Land Management
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Fresh Turn in Land Management
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- All Koreans should make vigorous endeavors to carry out the far-reaching plan of the Workers' Party of Korea for land construction with ardent patriotic enthusiasm and thus hand down beautiful land and rich resources to posterity.
					
					Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a bylined article.
					
					Leader Kim Jong Il's work "On Bringing about New Turn in Land Management" published on August 11, 1996 serves as important guidelines for land management to be held fast to at present when a powerful country is being built, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					Great changes have been made in land management over the last 15 years since the publication of the work.
					
					The land of the whole country has undergone changes as befitting the land of socialist Korea and a work has made dynamic progress to turn the land into a thick woodland and greenery thanks to far-reaching plan of Kim Jong Il and his energetic leadership. The landscape of the country has undergone a dramatic change in the true sense of the word: Many rivers have been more nicely transformed and there appeared a lot of new highways and monumental edifices in the era of Songun one after another.
					
					It is the noble intention of the WPK to turn the land of the fatherland, the legacy bequeathed by President Kim Il Sung to us, into the best one in the world and thus eternally glorify dignified Kim Il Sung's Korea.
					
					Thanks to the patriotic will of Kim Jong Il gigantic nature-harnessing projects were undertaken even in the period of the  most difficult Arduous March, forced march to give face-lifting to the land as required by the Songun era.
					
					The article calls for conducting the campaign for land management as a movement involving the whole party and society and thus turn the whole country into a socialist land of bliss.

articles.title: Nullification of Construction of Jeju Naval Base Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Nullification of Construction of Jeju Naval Base Called for in S. Korea
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- A peace rally took place on Jeju Island on August 6 to nullify the construction of the naval base on Jeju Island under the co-sponsorship of the All-Islanders Measure Committee for Checking the Jeju Military Base of south Korea and the Kangjong Village.
					
					Present there were opposition parties, civic and public organizations and youth and students organizations including the Democratic Labor Party, the Environment Movement Association and the Federation of University Students in the 21st Century and Kangjong villagers.
					
					At the rally speakers said the construction of the Jeju naval base is spawning a serious issue as it is not only destroying nature but being conducted illegally.
					
					The construction of the Jeju naval base should be totally nullified as it threatens the life of the people, they held.
					
					They urged the military authorities and the "government" to properly understand the aspiration of the people and stop at once the construction of the base.

articles.title: S. Korean Police's Suppression of Candlelight Actions Slammed
articles.content:
S. Korean Police's Suppression of Candlelight Actions Slammed
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Network of Registration Fee on August 7 denounced the fascist police authorities for their suppression of the candlelight actions for the settlement of registration fee issue.
					
					The police issued summons to more than 200 students and citizens who participated in the candlelight actions held from May to July, the organization said.
					
					It condemned the "government" for cracking down on the participants in the candlelight actions, far from honoring the commitment to halve the registration fee.
					
					It demanded the authorities stop at once the fascist actions and opt for settling the registration fee issue.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Costa Rica
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Costa Rica
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's work "The Democratic People's Republic of Korea Is the Socialist State of Juche with Invincible Might" was brought out in pamphlet by the Costa Rican Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea on August 3. 
					
					The work, published on September 5, Juche 97 (2008), explains in detail that it is possible to display the invincible might of the DPRK when President Kim Il Sung's Juche-oriented idea of nation-building and his exploits are upheld and eternally glorified.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Exploits Lauded by Paper of Democratic Congo
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Exploits Lauded by Paper of Democratic Congo
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- The paper of Democratic Congo L' Avenir on August 3 carried a portrait of smiling President Kim Il Sung and an article lauding his exploits. 
					
					The paper said that the President accomplished the historic cause of building the party, the army and the state and led the Korean people to win a victory in the Fatherland Liberation War against the armed invasion by the U.S. imperialists. 
					
					The President was awarded many orders and honorary titles by different countries for his exploits performed for the Korean revolution and global independence, the paper noted. 
					
					The paper referred to the fact that the immortal Juche idea founded by the President is being more briskly studied and disseminated in Democratic Congo than ever before for its great attraction.

articles.title: Three Charters for Reunification of Korea Supported
articles.content:
Three Charters for Reunification of Korea Supported
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- An organization of Germany and personages of Sweden and Democratic Congo fully supported the three charters for national reunification on the occasion of the 14th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification".
					
					The German Branch of the Korean Friendship Association on August 4 issued a statement saying that President Kim Il Sung laid down lines for national reunification in his lifetime, providing precious guidelines for achieving the reunification of the country. 
					
					The statement said that Kim Jong Il formulated the three principles of national reunification, the 10-point programme for the great unity of the whole nation and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo as the three charters for national reunification, making it possible to eternally glorify the immortal exploits the President performed for the reunification movement. 
					
					The statement called on the international community to positively support the Korean people in their struggle for reunifying their country by their own efforts free from outside interference.
					
					Christer Lundgren, chairman of the Sweden-Korea Friendship Association, in his statement on the same day said that it is important to conclude a peace treaty between the DPRK and the United States and improve the inter-Korean relations in the direction of achieving national reunification.
					
					The Korean people's cause of national reunification has enjoyed full support of the world progressive people, the statement noted. 
					
					The national secretary in charge of international relations of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Democratic Congo in his statement expressed full support for the proposals advanced by the President and Kim Jong Il and the efforts of the Workers' Party of Korea and its people to realize them.

articles.title: Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Marked by Cambodian Paper
articles.content:
Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Marked by Cambodian Paper
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- Pracheachon, the organ of the People's Party of Cambodia, on August 4 carried a special write-up with a photo of President Kim Il Sung on the 66th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					
					The paper in an article headlined "President Kim Il Sung's Feats Performed for Liberating Korea Will Shine Forever " said that the President achieved the cause of Korea's liberation through a 15 year-long anti-Japanese armed struggle.
					
					The liberation of Korea was a historic event as it brought about a dramatic change in the destiny of the Korean people and the birth of socialist Korea, the paper noted.
					
					A popular country, a powerful socialist state, the first of its kind in the Korean nation's history spanning five thousand years was built in Korea, it said, adding the feats the President performed for liberating Korea would shine long along with prospering socialist Korea.

articles.title: Living Conditions of Poor Improved in Heilongjiang Province, China
articles.content:
Living Conditions of Poor Improved in Heilongjiang Province, China
						

					Beijing, August 9 (KCNA) -- The living conditions of 2.41 million poor people were improved in Heilongjiang Province, China from 2001 to 2010.
					
					During the period the province pushed forward the farmland irrigation and infrastructural construction in the areas where poor people are living.

articles.title: Zhejiang Province, China Damaged by Typhoon
articles.content:
Zhejiang Province, China Damaged by Typhoon
						

					Beijing, August 9 (KCNA) -- Typhoon hit Zhejiang Province, China on August 7, bringing down many dwelling houses and devastating 690 hectares of farmlands.
					
					363 000 people were evacuated.
					
					The production was suspended in over 440 enterprises, highways destroyed and dams collapsed.
					
					Emergency relief steps are being taken in the province.

articles.title: Kenyan President Calls for Joint Efforts of International Community
articles.content:
Kenyan President Calls for Joint Efforts of International Community
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- Kenyan President Mwai Kibaki at a diplomatic function held on Thursday called on the international community to make concerted efforts to mitigate the devastating drought in the Horn of Africa region.
					
					The devastating drought ravaging through the region, President Kibaki said, has left over 10 million in the region in dire need of humanitarian assistance. He underlined the need to prevent such disasters.

articles.title: Cement and Clinker Production Increases in Iran
articles.content:
Cement and Clinker Production Increases in Iran
						

					Tehran, August 9 (KCNA) -- The production of cement and clinker increased 19 percent and 13.8 percent respectively in the first four months of the current Iranian year starting in March this year as compared with that in the same period of last year. This was made public by a newspaper of Iran recently.

articles.title: Exports Rise in Indonesia
articles.content:
Exports Rise in Indonesia
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- Indonesia's exports growth has accelerated in the first half of this year. The cumulative of exports by June rose by 36.02 percent, compared with that of the same period of last year. Exports of palm oil, coal and others have risen during the period. They were announced by the National Statistic Agency on Friday.

articles.title: Agriculture Develops in Myanmar
articles.content:
Agriculture Develops in Myanmar
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- Myanmar is directing efforts to developing agriculture.
					
					The minister of Agriculture and Irrigation on August 3 called on agricultural experts to hand down technique on production of high yield crops to farmers. Good agricultural methods should be widely introduced through TV, radio and newspapers, he added.
					
					The total sown area is growing remarkably to about 13.7 million hectares thanks to the government.

articles.title: Tree Planting in Niger
articles.content:
Tree Planting in Niger
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- Tree planting is progressing apace in Niger.
					
					Over 6.4 million trees have been planted by the end of July this year.
					
					This was announced by the minister of hydropower and environment of the country on August 3.

articles.title: Cooperation among Different Countries
articles.content:
Cooperation among Different Countries
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- China and Poland on August 5 agreed to develop bilateral cooperation in such fields as economy, trading, infrastructure, energy and environmental protection.
					
					On August 4 Maldives and Seychelles signed a Memorandum of Understanding on Fisheries Cooperation.

articles.title: France Slams Israel's Settlement Expansion Plan
articles.content:
France Slams Israel's Settlement Expansion Plan
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- A deputy spokesperson for the French Foreign Ministry on August 5 accused Israel of its plan to expand Jewish settlements.
					
					The Israeli authorities on August 4 decided to construct some 900 new homes in East Kuds. In this regard the deputy spokesperson said "We call on Israel to reconsider this decision, whose implementation would increase tensions and throw more difficulties in the way of resuming negotiations between Palestine and Israel".
					
					She urged the Israeli authorities to retract the decision at once.

articles.title: Americans Disapprove of Congress
articles.content:
Americans Disapprove of Congress
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- Americans' disapproval of U.S. Congress is increasing as it is locked only in political arguments among factions.
					
					Eighty-two percent disapproved of Congress' performance. A New York Times/CBS News poll indicated this in the survey released Friday.

articles.title: Japan's Trade Deficit
articles.content:
Japan's Trade Deficit
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- Japan registered a 317.43 billion yen trade deficit in the first 20 days of last month, the Finance Ministry said Friday.

articles.title: 31 U.S. Soldiers Die in Helicopter Crash in Afghanistan
articles.content:
31 U.S. Soldiers Die in Helicopter Crash in Afghanistan
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- A helicopter crash in east Afghanistan on August 6 has left 31 members of the U.S. special forces dead.
					
					The helicopter was conducting an "anti-terrorist war" in eastern Wardak Province.

articles.title: Venezuelan President Calls for Getting Rid of U.S. Dollar Dictatorship
articles.content:
Venezuelan President Calls for Getting Rid of U.S. Dollar Dictatorship
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- Venezuelan President Hugo Chavez Frias, speaking at a Cabinet meeting on August 6, called upon the world to get rid of the U.S. dollar dictatorship.
					
					He branded U.S. dollar note as "paper not worth a penny", adding the U.S. will get sick over the financial issue in the future. The financial crisis of the "empire" will be further deteriorated, he noted.
					
					The grave developments in the capitalist world show that the world should make a U-turn and be freed from the U.S. dollar dictatorship, the Yankee imperialists' dictatorship, he stressed.

articles.title: Colombian President Calls for Making Effective Use of Local Currencies
articles.content:
Colombian President Calls for Making Effective Use of Local Currencies
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- Colombian President Juan Manuel Santos in a speech at an event on August 5 called upon Latin American countries to make an effective use of local currencies.
					
					He said that the appreciation of local currencies is hitting exporting sectors and the capacity to generate jobs while the weakening of the dollar takes value away from reserves.
					
					He called upon Latin American countries to keep pace with each other in the financial and economic activities.

articles.title: Russia Urges Israel to Stop Building Jewish Settlements
articles.content:
Russia Urges Israel to Stop Building Jewish Settlements
						

					Moscow, August 9 (KCNA) -- The Russian Foreign Ministry on August 6 accused Israel of its continued moves to build Jewish settlements.
					
					Recently the Israeli authorities decided to construct about 900 Jewish housing units. The Russian Foreign Ministry termed it Israeli attempt to secure the results of Palestine-Israel talks on the final position in its favor.
					
					Russia has already expressed more than once its stand against Israel's stepped up construction of settlements in the occupied Palestinian territories, it said, urging Israel to stop building the settlements.

articles.title: Earthquake Hits Japan
articles.content:
Earthquake Hits Japan
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- A 5.2-magnitude earthquake hit the waters off the eastern area of Chiba Prefecture, Japan on August 6.
					
					The epicenter was 10 km deep in the sea.

articles.title: Railway Transport Volume Increases in Belarus
articles.content:
Railway Transport Volume Increases in Belarus
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- Belarus is directing efforts to developing the railway transport to increase freight volume.
					
					The railway transport increased 13.5 percent in the first half of this year over the same period of last year.

articles.title: Dramatic Changes in Tibet over Last Six Decades under Banner of Socialism
articles.content:
Dramatic Changes in Tibet over Last Six Decades under Banner of Socialism
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- Dramatic changes have taken place in all fields of the Tibet Autonomous Region of China over the last six decades under the banner of socialism. 
					
					Tibet's total gross output value increased 111.8 times in 2010, compared with that in 1951.
					
					Annual economic growth rate reached 12.4 percent during the period of the 11th Five-Year Plan.
					
					The Tibetan people who could not make even a screw nail and a matchstick in the past have solved the power problem by building power stations in Lhasa by their own efforts after the liberation.
					
					They built a lot of small and big factories and enterprises to lay agricultural and stock-farming foundation suitable for industrial fields including electric power, coal, chemistry, machine building and building materials and natural conditions. 
					
					There was not a single proper road in Tibet in the past, but all towns and villages and more than 80 percent of local administrative villages have motorways at present. Their total length is 58 200km. 
					
					The Tibet Autonomous Region has at least 52 100 technicians. They carried out 3 253 scientific and technological research tasks for economic development last year alone. 
					
					There are many schools in different parts of Tibet. At present, the enrollment rate of primary school-aged children in Tibet stood at 99.2 percent and the enrollment rate of secondary school is 98.2 percent. Tibet's illiteracy rate now stands at 1.2 percent.
					
					Hospitals equipped with modern medical facilities in different parts of the Autonomous Region are operating for the health of the inhabitants. 
					
					According to the statistics, Tibet's mortality rate of pregnant women and nursing mothers dropped to 231 now from 5 000 per 100 000 before the liberation.
					
					And an average life span of its population increased to 67 from 35.5 in 1959. 
					
					All these successes in Tibet are attributable to the correct national policy of the Communist Party of China and people's government and its vitality. 
					
					The Tibetan people are now working hard to make their native land a region better to live in under the leadership of the CPC which brought about the liberation of Tibet and ushered in a new era of prosperity.

articles.title: Strong Foundation for Socialist Construction in Venezuela
articles.content:
Strong Foundation for Socialist Construction in Venezuela
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- The Venezuelan government and people are waging a dynamic struggle to lay a firm foundation for building Bolivar socialism, holding high the banner of socialism.
					
					In order to provide a firm political and legal foundation for socialist development, the Venezuelan government decided to basically revise the previous constitution in mid-February 2009.
					
					According to it, the government worked out a proposal for the amendment to the constitution aimed at building "Venezuela-style socialism in the 21st century" and successfully held a people's referendum on it.
					
					Venezuelan President Hugo Chavez Frias in a speech at a recent Cabinet meeting said that the only thing possible is to make a transition to Bolivar socialism from capitalism, underlining the need to deepen the construction of Venezuela-style socialism based on the theory of scientific planning being put into practice now.
					
					The Venezuelan government has steadily stepped up the work to nationalize the oil industry and other major economic fields, reinforcing the material foundation for socialist construction. 
					
					The law on nationalizing oil supply companies was already adopted in Venezuela in May 2009. According to it, 20 oil supply companies in Zulia State and their properties were owned by the state and a step was taken to nationalize the U.S. oil company in Monagas State.
					
					In June last year the country nationalized 11 oil facilities under the U.S. companies, thus laid a foundation for tightening the government control over the economic sectors and developing the oil industry.
					
					The Venezuelan president in a TV address affirmed that the nationalization would mark the beginning of the establishment of an industrial complex and lay a solid foundation for the victory of socialism. The Venezuelan working class will clearly show the whole world how they would carry out the revolution, he said, re-clarifying the government's stand to push forward the nationalization.
					
					The oil deposit prospected and secured by Venezuela so far amounts to 296.5 billion bbl, the largest in the world, a press report said.
					
					The government aims to increase the daily average oil production to 4 million bbl till 2015 from 3.1 million bbl at present and to 6 million bbl till 2019.
					
					Efforts are making rapid progress to facilitate housing construction and secure more jobs.
					
					Projects are now under way in Miranda State to build 20 000 flats and 1 200 flats in Aragua State.
					
					The government is planning to undertake large-scale housing construction from this year to 2017 with huge investment.
					
					It was reported that in order to fully settle the unemployment issue in eight years to come, the government would provide 3.5 million jobs and, at the same time, carry out a new plan for vocational education.
					
					The government is also directing big efforts to bolstering the defense capability to provide a military guarantee for the successful building of socialism.
					
					Under the situation where the U.S. is undisguisedly revealing its attempt at aggression after building its military base in Colombia, the Venezuelan government is making sure that all the servicepersons and people are keeping themselves combat-ready to cope with this.
					
					The Venezuelan president underscored the need to defend the inviolable sovereignty of the country and the Bolivar revolution from the aggression by the imperialists and their stooges. To this end, one should be ready to sacrifice oneself and all the services of the army, the Bolivar police and people should take arms in hands and get fully prepared to go into action, he stressed.
					
					The government and people of Venezuela are sure to build good Venezuela-style socialism, overcoming all difficulties and ordeals as they are confidently advancing along the road of independence, believing in their strength.

articles.title: Six Bombers to Be Delivered to Russian Air Force
articles.content:
Six Bombers to Be Delivered to Russian Air Force
						

					Moscow, August 9 (KCNA) -- The Russian air force will receive six Su-34 bombers this year.
					
					The bombers have been manufactured by the Novosibirsk Aircraft Factory according to a contract with the Defense Ministry, said Interfax.
					
					The five-year contract was made between the Defense Ministry and the Sukhoi Air Military Industry Complex in 2008.
					
					The factory already manufactured four Su-34 bombers in 2010.

articles.title: Overseas Young Chinese Businessmen Urged to Contribute to Homeland
articles.content:
Overseas Young Chinese Businessmen Urged to Contribute to Homeland
						

					Beijing, August 9 (KCNA) -- Ren Qiliang, a vice-director of the Office of Overseas Chinese Affairs of the State Council of China, on August 2 called for raising the role of young Chinese businessmen residing abroad.
					
					Addressing the 10th friendship meeting of the training institute for overseas young businessmen, Ren urged them to avail themselves of the opportunity of China's fresh development during the 12th five-year plan, promote their businesses and contribute to exchange and cooperation between China and countries where they reside.

articles.title: China, Russia Agree to Jointly Meet Challenges
articles.content:
China, Russia Agree to Jointly Meet Challenges
						

					Beijing, August 9 (KCNA) -- China and Russia agreed to jointly cope with new international and regional threat and challenges.
					
					The agreement came in a joint press release published at the end of the Russia visit of Chen Bingde, chief of the General Staff of the Chinese People's Liberation Army, from August 3 to 8.
					
					The press release highly appreciates what the two countries have achieved in the development of the strategic cooperation partnership over the last decade since the conclusion of the bilateral treaty on good-neighbor friendship and cooperation.
					
					Both sides also agreed to continue mutual visits and exchange of strategic views between the two armies.

articles.title: Cuban Court Rejects Appeal of U.S. Spy
articles.content:
Cuban Court Rejects Appeal of U.S. Spy
						

					Havana, August 9 (KCNA) -- The Cuban Supreme People's Court Friday rejected an appeal of U.S. spy Alan Phillip Gross arrested for acts threatening the country's security and territorial integrity.
					
					The spy had appealed against the 15-year prison sentence passed by the Havana Court.
					
					The Supreme People's Court also disallowed defense.

articles.title: Test Flight of Stealth Fighter Delayed in U.S.
articles.content:
Test Flight of Stealth Fighter Delayed in U.S.
						

					Pyongyang, August 10 (KCNA) -- A test flight of next-generation stealth fighter "F-35" was delayed in the United States recently.
					
					The flight was planned to be tested at an air base in California but it was delayed due to an engine trouble, said a media report.

articles.title: China Intensifies Campaign for Safeguarding Food
articles.content:
China Intensifies Campaign for Safeguarding Food
						

					Beijing, August 9 (KCNA) -- China has successfully conducted a special operation for cracking down on illegal additives in food or their abuse from April.
					
					As of July 31, agricultural, industrial, commercial, quality control and food authorities in their coordinated efforts have shut down more than 4 900 businesses for illegal practices, according to a statement issued by the Food Safety Commission under the State Council.
					
					The police have destroyed a series of underground sites for illegal production, storage and processing of food products and arrested approximately 2 000 suspects.

articles.title: Manuel Santos insiste en fomentar uso de monedas nacionales
articles.content:
Manuel Santos insiste en fomentar uso de monedas nacionales
						

					Pyongyang, 10 de agosto (ACNC) -- El presidente colombiano, Juan Manuel Santos, en su discurso pronunciado el dia 5 en un acto, insistio en fomentar el uso de las monedas nacionales entre los paises de la region de la America Latina.
					
					El uso de las monedas nacionales sirve de una fuerza motriz en incrementar la exportacion y crear los empleos en los paises  regionales, dijo y  anadio que ahora cae cada dia el valor de dolar norteamericano.
					
					Exhorto a los paises latinoamericanos a tomar las acciones conjuntas en las actividades de la economia financiera.

articles.title: Danos ocasionados por el tifon-9 en la RPDC
articles.content:
Danos ocasionados por el tifon-9 en la RPDC
						

					Pyongyang, 10 de agosto (ACNC) -- Segun los datos recogidos por el organo correspondiente de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, por el tifon-9 que paso de la noche del dia 7 al 9, fueron muertos mas de 10 habitantes y damnificadas mas de 240 viviendas.
					
					En las provincias de Hwanghae del Sur y del Norte, granero importante, la de Hamgyong del Sur y otras zonas coreanas mas de 25 mil 800 hectareas de tierras cultivables quedaron severamente damnificadas a causa de vientos fuertes y lluvias torrenciales, debido a lo cual no se esperara la cosecha y decenas de edificios publicos fueron destruidos.
					
					Mas de 10 puentes quedaron cortados y tumbados mas de 4 mil arboles del borde de la calle, lo cual obstaculiza el transporte de los articulos de primera necesidad y los materiales necesarios a la recuperacion de  las zonas danadas.

articles.title: Viento fuerte y lluvias torrenciales por Tifon-9
articles.content:
Viento fuerte y lluvias torrenciales  por Tifon-9
						

					Pyongyang, 10 de agosto (ACNC) -- Por la influencia del tifon-9, soplo un viento fuerte y cayeron  muchas lluvias en varias localidades de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					Alcanzo a mas de 10-15m/s la velocidad del viento, reportada desde la noche del dia 7 hasta el 8 en las provincias de Phyong-an del Sur, de Hwanghae del Sur y del Norte y de Kangwon.
					
					En particular, se registraron 20m/s en el distrito de Onchon de la ciudad de Nampho; 19m/s en el capitalino municipio de Samsok y el distrito de Jangphung de la ciudad de Kaesong; 18m/s en la ciudad de Sariwon y el distrito de Sohung de la provincia de Hwanghae del Norte y en los distritos de Ongjin, Yon-an, Kangryong, Samchon y Pongchon de la provincia de Hwanghae del  Sur; 17m/s en la ciudad de Haeju y los distritos de Paechon, Ryongyon y Chongdang de la provincia de Hwanghae del Sur.
					
					Desde a las 21 del dia 7 hasta a las 12 del 9 cayeron las lluvias de 170mm, 132mm y 128mm en los distritos de Sinchon, Pyoksong y Sinwon de la provincia de Hwanghae del Sur; 126mm en el distrito de Rinsan de la provincia de Hwanghae del Norte; 156mm, 119mm y 117mm en el distrito de Chonma, la ciudad de Kusong y el distrito de Tongchang de la provincia de Phyong-an del Norte; 125mm en el distrito de Songwon de la provincia de Jagang; 115mm y 114mm en la comunidad obrera de Sudong y el distrito de Pujon de la provincia de Hamgyong del Sur, respectivamente, asi como mas de 100mm en cerca de 20 zonas.
					
					En todas las localidades de Corea se libran las labores para eliminar las consecuencias de los desastres mas ampliados por el tifon-9.

articles.title: Extranjeros alaban Tres Cartas para la Reunificacion de la Patria
articles.content:
Extranjeros alaban Tres Cartas para la Reunificacion de la Patria
						

					Pyongyang, 10 de agosto (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 14o aniversario de la publicacion de la obra del Dirigente Kim Jong Il "Materialicemos de modo consecuente el legado del gran Lider, camarada   Kim Il Sung, para la reunificacion de la Patria", una entidad alemana y varias personalidades de Suecia y el Congo Democratico expresaron el irrestricto apoyo a las Tres Cartas para la Reunificacion de la Patria.
					
					La sucursal alemana de la Asociacion de Amistad con Corea, en su declaracion fechada 4, enumero que durante su vida el Presidente Kim Il Sung presento las lineas para la reunificacion de Corea y preparo una valiosa guia para el particular.
					
					El Dirigente formulo como las Tres Cartas para la Reunificacion de la Patria los Tres principios de la Reunificacion de la Patria, el Programa de Diez Puntos de la Gran Unidad Pannacional y el Proyecto de la Fundacion de la Republica Federal Democratica de Coryo para transmitir de generacion en generacion las imborrables hazanas del Presidente acumuladas ante el movimiento por la reunificacion, senalo.
					
					Exhorto a la sociedad internacional a apoyar activamente la lucha del pueblo coreano por lograr la reunificacion del pais con sus propias fuerzas sin injerencia de las fuerzas foraneas.
					
					En su nota publicada el mismo dia, Christer Lundgren, presidente de la Asociacion de Amistad Suecia-Corea, preciso que es importante concertar el convenio de paz entre la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Estados Unidos y mejorar las relaciones intercoreanas cuyo objetivo es la reunificacion de la nacion coreana.
					
					Subrayo que la causa de la reunificacion de la patria del pueblo coreano goza de apoyo y respaldo unanimes de los pueblos progresistas del mundo entero.
					
					Tambien el secretario nacional encargado de relaciones internacionales del Comite Central del Partido Comunista del Congo Democratico hizo publica una declaracion, en la cual expreso su apoyo total a los proyectos de la reunificacion de la patria presentados por el Presidente y el Dirigente y a los esfuerzos del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y el pueblo coreano por llevarlos a efecto.
